author: caleb sayer
comment: Doesn't work... Says it's working, records nothing. How far did I run? How fast? I have no idea, because it doesn't work.

author: M Lev
comment: Truly free and open source. Has all the functionality I want from this App and more! Even works with my old Pebble classic watch!! Thank you developer!!! 🙏 🌷 💐

author: Oleg Kravchenko
comment: Sync to services, compatible with many HR sensors,  HR zone target with insistent "speed up/slow down" audio cues and lot of settings, absolutely free and without ads.

author: Alan Smith
comment: Does real-time lap pace for tempo runs! Links to so many other apps!

author: Gábor Fekete
comment: Eddig jó, a Google Fit csatlakozás sajnos nekem nem megy

author: Keith Garland
comment: It does everything you need and more

author: Troy Vitullo
comment: Finally I own my workout data

author: Joseph Speirs
comment: Was great, this update broke the heart rate tracker... Literally the only reason I use this app. It'll tell you if you're below but not above target HR... Also history only shows everything in zone 0... I want to roll back to the last version... Anyone know how?

Good basic run tracking app w/o requiring online user accounts and w/o advertisement. The distance tracking errs on being roughly 10% over actual on my device. There seems to be a bug calculating time when tracking through AM / PM transition.

author: Yiu Man Chi
comment: is the Google fit upload broken? otherwise very good app, works on very old device(2.3) too

author: Marcel Ionut
comment: It is a great app. Did you think about adding a metronome for cadence (runzi like)? This would make it the perfect running tool. Thank you in advance!

author: Jessica C
comment: Very accurate gps running app for showing my top sprinting speed on the Galaxy S5. If you can run 20+ MPH, the lines are little or none jagged.  It would be great if there was a max speed and instantaneous speed reading rather than just average pace without pausing to look at the pace graph.

author: Gregory Henry
comment: This is one of the best apps for long distance training. I use it to train for my 5K runs.

author: Sabani Toko Banjar
comment: Hope in next update add feature follow route, add or import route from gpx file and display it Pebble.. Thanks developer..
Everything you need while running...customisible audio cues, heart rate, and direct upload to Strava.

author: Pranav Chaple
comment: Poor.. always its getting pause.. No count

author: Nikola Ilic
comment: Great app! Can we get round icon for 7.1.2?

author: Miguel Lasa
comment: Fantastic keep updates

This could be the perfect tracking up for runners. Endlessly customizable to your training, no nonsense, no rape of your privacy "in the cloud", lots of upload options. But the recorded tracks appear as very jaggy lines with no detail whatsoever, you only get a very rough idea were you ran. This is a known issue to the developer and has been reported several times in the GitHub of RunnerUp. Until this is fixed, I simply cannot recommend this app. Which is a shame because RunnerUp has everything to become THE app for tracking runs. Except that the core functionality, recording runs, is broken. I would love to be able to use and RELY on RunnerUp.

author: Sarah Hudson
comment: My go to fitness tracker on my phone. Love the sync with other services.
title: Convenient

author: Paul Lunardi
comment: Used to love it but now can't detect my polar h7. Please fix.

reply.author: Jonas Oreland
reply.content: new runnerup version or new android version?

author: Peter Steele
comment: Good job

author: Jeff H
comment: It's a nice app, but the distance tracking algorithm logs significantly less distance if I'm running slower on a very regular course that should consistently be the same distance.  Running on mountain courses also seems to log far less than the actual distance, but that's probably a limitation of GPS, since phones don't come with altimeters to measure elevation changes.  So this is mostly useful as a stopwatch and workout tracker for time, not so useful for distance and pace.
title: Good, but the distance tracking is not very accurate

author: Curt Jackson
comment: I really really want this to be my primary running app, but the distance accuracy is way out for me. A 7.5km run gets logged as 9.3km. it's happened 4 times now, so doesn't seem to be a glitch. Haven't noticed anyone else with such a big discrepancy so maybe it's just me, but everything's on default settings so not sure what it is, but it makes the app unusable for me sadly.
title: Accuracy issues

author: Gehad Ahmed
comment: Great app, no ads, support creating interval workouts.
title: Love the interval workouts

author: Chris Mulkey
comment: I love the idea of this app, but it's not ready to replace the big time run tracking services yet.  I was able to connect to RunnerUp to my RunKeeper, Endomondo, Runtastic, and Google Fit accounts, but the app crashed every time I tried logging in to my Strava account and constantly re-promted me for credentials when I tried tying it to my MapMyRun account. The UI isn't pretty, but it gets the job done.  I just wish there were a "treadmill mode" - a way to record activity without a GPS (which would allow heart rate capture), and then manually define the your Miles Traveled before saving (and publishing) your activity. There's a lot of promise here, it just doesn't quite deliver yet.  (For what it's worth, I'd absolutely be willing to pay for the app if it were a little more stable and if it worked with MapMyRun.)

author: Abel Valente
comment: Great app. Great features. It has all the versatility I couldn't find on the free apps by the big players. I wanted to configure the audio cues in more specific ways and this app has everything I needed.

author: John Fowler
comment: No adds. Takes a little time to navigate through and learn but the best I've ever used

author: Galina Shubina
comment: Best running up with no ads or other crap

author: sam condrot
comment: Good no adds, plenty of controls.

author: Dimitrios Kanellopoulos
comment: Dude. The design sucks. Fix it and then we can contribute

author: Bill Rizzo
comment: Great App, love the voice feedback

author: Andrew Bohanna
comment: I've tried all the big running apps but none (even when premium) offer the level of customisation I'm looking for with my interval training. The gui may not be pretty, but it does everything I need.
title: Best for custom intervals

author: Yoppy
comment: Functionality-wise it's the best app for running. It has features that even some of the expensive / premium apps don't. Not only it's free, it can easily syncs to other services (garmin Connect, strava, you name it..)
title: Best running training app

author: Mit Humor
comment: Pulse Heart Rate Monitor H7 works w S6. Improvement suggestions: 1. add altitude graph and statistics. 2. Show major statistics (current and avg time/speed/dist/hart rate) in big chars while running.
title: Great App w some improvement potential

author: Rex Lee
comment: It's too bad accurate data of map trace and graph after change map.
title: hope to return map to google'

author: Michael Amick
comment: Closest thing to runmeter I could find for Android. I tried RunKeeper, and runtastic, both of which charge a lot for the premium version. Neither of which works well enough for me. Runtastic is integrated with Google Earth, which is nice. But I couldn't get it to work with my heart rate monitor.
title: Works with Scoche Rythym+

author: K Mc
comment: I love the app but am finding the GPS is not accurate and adds little zigzags to my run, enjoy that a short run of 3.5 km is off by 250 m or so.
title: GPS not accurate

author: Mats Holm
comment: Great simple app. Does everything I need in a running app with out the stuff i don't need.  It has voice feedback, auto pause, lap times, map, manual entry when you want the audio or distance cues or etc.  Great app, highly recommended!

author: Jim Arnell
comment: Gathers data flawlessly and synchrizes with all the fitness sites I use.
title: Awesome app!
